keyword: how many calories is in an egg roll
title: How Many Calories in an Egg Roll?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in an egg roll, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and tweaks for baked or sauced versions.
h1: How Many Calories in an Egg Roll?
assumptions: Standard vegetable egg roll, fried, ~50 g each, typical Chinese restaurant style with cabbage, carrots, no meat.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, filling type, frying method, size, and added sauces. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One fried vegetable egg roll has about 200 kcal and 6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp sweet and sour sauce

faqs.q: How many calories is in an egg roll?
faqs.a: Approximately 200 kcal for one standard fried vegetable egg roll.

faqs.q: Are egg rolls high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, about 22 g carbs per egg roll, mostly from the wrapper.

faqs.q: How much fat in an egg roll?
faqs.a: Around 10 g total fat, with 1.5 g saturated, due to frying.

faqs.q: Can I make egg rolls lower calorie?
faqs.a: Baking or air-frying reduces calories by 50-100 kcal per roll.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in an egg roll?
faqs.a: About 300 mg per egg roll, varying with seasonings.
